cv.division1: University of Lodz, Faculty of Physics and Applied Informatics
cv.division2: University of Lodz, Faculty of International and Political Studies
cv.name1: Marshal's Office in Łodz - Department of Promotion and International Cooperation
cv.desc1: Amongst my duties as an intern were editing weekly reports on US and China foreign policy, translating documents and carrying out ongoing projects. Usually they concerned cooperation with the Chinese province of Chengdu.
cv.desc2: As a volunteer, I helped organize events promoting the region, moderated the website and held duty at the office.
cv.desc3: I have been involved in the science club activities throughout the entire length of first degree studies. Already in the first year we organized a monthly scientific expedition to Thailand, Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia. We also organized a series of meetings with travelers at the Daleko Blisko cafe.

agile.title: Agile
agile.p1: Although I have never worked in a team managed by agile methodologies, I know a lot about it. The philosophy of Agile and her relatives is no stranger to me.
agile.p2: I often use the Kanban method myself when managing my own project.

android.title: Android Studio
android.p1: Thanks to Android Studio I created my first mobile application in Java.
android.p2: It is a bit like working on a website, except that instead of HTML and CSS you use .xml files and instead of JavaScript, Java.

angular.title: Angular.io
angular.p1: The site you are currently browsing was created thanks to Angular!
angular.p2: After mastering HTML, CSS and JavaScript to the extent that allows me to create content myself, I began learning Angular along with the TypeScript language and SCSS syntax.

bootstrap.title: Bootstrap
bootstrap.p1: I use Bootstrap to build responsive websites, scaled to different device sizes. I know the basics of the library in its latest version - Bootstrap 4.

chinese.title: Chinese
chinese.p1: I studied Chinese at first-degree studies. Twice I attended a summer school in China, where I worked on my language skills not only in class but also during everyday activities, such as shopping or ordering food in the canteen.
chinese.p2: I am currently presenting a level close to B1 and I am able to have a simple conversation in this language.

css.title: CSS
css.p1: I learned how to work with CSS style sheets together with HTML, initially operating on pure CSS3.
css.p2: Over time, I began to appreciate Sass and Less solutions for nesting classes and creating variables. Today, I use both of these solutions thanks to SCSS and convenient plug-ins for Visual Studio Code.

git.title: Git
git.p1: I usually create projects myself, so initially I started to use Git to familiarize myself with this functionality.
git.p2: Git is very useful for sharing my code with the world. Currently, I'm trying to keep the good habits by regularly uploading new projects and frequent use of commits.

html.title: HTML
html.p1: I started learning HTML in online courses along with CSS. I wrote my first website with one view thanks to HTML and CSS.
html.p2: While coding I try to use the possibilities offered by the latest version of this language, HTML5.
